title: "2020 Syllabus (Tentative)"
---

Please follow instructions for installing packages in R [here](E2M2-2018/E2M2_InstallPackages.html).

**Friday, Jan 3 - Sunday, Jan 5: Mentor Research Workshop** 

* Half of the instructor team works with mentors on their research during this period. The other half teaches the R Bootcamp -- see below.

**Friday, Jan 3: ‘R Bootcamp’ (attendance optional)** 

* 9:00-9:30am: Brief Introductions 
* 9:30-10:30am: Lecture: Intro to R Studio 
* 10:30-11:00am: Coffee Break
* 11:00am-12:00pm: Small Groups: Software installation and catch-up. Mentors + instructors make sure all students have the proper materials installed and work through Intro Tutorial.
* 12:00-2:00pm: Lunch + extra time if certain students need extra time for downloads/installations.
* 2:00-3:00pm: Tutorial: Intro to R Studio 
  * Includes:
      * Knowing your working environment
      * Assigning variables
      * Basic arithmetic
      * Running a script
* 3:00-3:30pm: Coffee Break 
* 3:30-5:00pm: Tutorial: Intro to R Studio
  * continued from above
  
  
**Saturday, Jan 4: ‘R Bootcamp’ (attendance optional)** 

* 9:00-10:30am: Lecture: Exploring & visualizing data in R
* 10:30-11:00am: Coffee Break
* 11:00am-12:00pm: Tutorial: Exploring & visualizing data in R
  * Continued from above.
* 12:00-1:00pm: Lunch 
* 1:00-3:00pm: Lecture: Writing For-loops, If-Else Statements, and Functions in R 
* 3:00-3:30pm: Coffee Break
* 3:30-5:00pm: Tutorial: Writing For-loops, If-Else Statements, and Functions in R 
  * Continued from above.


**Sunday, Jan 5: ‘R Bootcamp’ (attendance optional)** *(at [Institut Pasteur de Madagascar](http://www.pasteur.mg/) in Antananarivo)*

* 9:00-10:30am: Lecture/Tutorial: Data cleaning in R
* 10:30-11:00am: Coffee Break
* 10:30am-12:00pm: Tutorial: Data cleaning in R
* 12:00-1:00pm: Lunch
* 1:00-2:00pm:  Lecture/Tutorial: Intro to Spatial Visualization and Plotting
* 2:00-3:00pm: Time for students to load and clean their own datasets if they have them. Otherwise, students are free to go home.
* 3:00-3:30pm: Coffee Break
* 3:30-5:00pm: Open mentoring session for outstanding questions or continued work on tutorials from above

**Monday, Jan 6: “Travel Day"**

* 6:00am: Meet at Institut Pasteur for departure to Ranomafana (lunch stop Ambositra)
* 6:30-7:30pm: Dinner
* 7:30-8:30pm: Introductions and Beginning Malagasy Lession __(Mentors)__
* 8:30-9:00pm: Ice Breakers 

**Tuesday, Jan 7: “Dealing with Data”**

* 6:30-8:00am: Breakfast
* 8:00-8:30am: Road Map and Daily Agenda. Brief Introductions (animals worked well last year) 
* 8:30-10:00am: Lecture: What are We Doing Here? Data and Models 
* 10:00-10:30am: Coffee Break
* 10:30-12:00pm: Intro to Epidemiology and Ecology
* 12:00-1:00pm: Lunch
* 1:00-2:00pm: Introductions: 2-min student/mentor/instructor introductions
* 2:30-4:00pm: Formulating research questions
* 4:00-4:30pm: Coffee Break
* 4:30-6:30pm: Study Design and Data Collection, with examples from ecology and epidemiology.
* 6:30-7:30pm: Dinner

**Wednesday, Jan 8: “Building Simple Models”**

* 6:30-8:00am: Breakfast
* 8:00-8:15am: Road Map and Daily Agenda 
* 8:15-10:00am: Lecture/Tutorial: Lecture: Linear regression and simple statistics
* 10:00-10:30am: Coffee Break; prep for hike
* 10:30am-1pm: Morning hike in Ranomafana National Park
* 1:00-1:45pm: Lunch
* 1:45-3:00pm: Exercise + Discussion: Dynamical Fever 
* 3:00-3:30pm: Coffee Break 
* 3:30-5:30pm: Lecture/Tutorial: Introduction to Compartmental Models and Differential Equations
* 5:30-6:30pm: Small Group Sessions: Refining research questions for modeling __(all instructors lead small groups)__
  * All students should have a workable statistical and mechanistic question by the end of the session
  * For HW, assign: Creating a model world to address a research question, but **it will not be due until Thursday**
* 6:30-7:30pm: Dinner


**Thursday, Jan 9: “More Complicated Models”**

* 6:30-8:00am: Breakfast
* 8:00-8:15am: Road Map and Daily Agenda __(Cara)__
* 8:15-10:00am: Lecture/Tutorial: Introduction to Mixed Modeling
* 10:30-11:00am: Coffee Break
* 11:00am-12:00pm: Lecture w/Tutorial: Model Fitting in Practice – the Basic Concept
* 12:00-1:00pm: Lunch
* 1:00-2:00pm: Small Group Discussion: Reading a Research Paper __(Mentors)__
* 2:00-3:00pm: Exercise: Epidemics Cards
* 3:00-3:30pm: Coffee Break
* 3:30-5:00pm: Tutorial: Model Fitting with Epidemic Cards
* 5:00-6:30pm: Mid-session feedback.
* 6:30-7:30pm: Dinner


**Friday, Jan 10: “Adding Bells and Whistles”**

* 6:30-8:00am: Breakfast
* 8:00-8:15am: Road Map and Daily Agenda 
* 8:15-8:30am: Response to Feedback
* 8:30-10:00am: Lecture w/Tutorial: Introduction to Occupancy Modeling
* 9:45-10:15am: Coffee Break
* 10:30am-12:00pm: Lecture/Tutorial: Advances in Spatial Modeling
* 12:00-1:00pm: Lunch
* 1:00-2:30pm: Model Telephone with Model Diagrams 
* 2:30-3:00pm: Final research plans (HW) 
* 3:00-3:30pm: Coffee Break
* 3:30-5:00pm: Exercise/Activity to generate/understand ecological data
* 5:00-6:30pm: Work time + one-on-one student-instructor meetings
* 6:30-7:30pm: Dinner
* 8:00pm: Night walk Ranomafana National Park (optional)


**Saturday, Jan 11: “Refining Your Work”**

* 6:30-8:00am: Breakfast
* 8:00-8:30am: Road Map and Daily Agenda 
* 8:30-10:30am: Lecture/Tutorial: Model Selection and Comparison
* 10:30-11:00am: Coffee Break
* 11:00-12:00pm:  Lecture w/Tutorial: Introduction to Network Modeling 
* 12:00pm-1:00pm: Lunch
* 1:00-1:30pm: Group photo - Wear your E2M2 shirts!
* 1:30-3:00pm: Lecture/Tutorial: Compartmental Model Extensions
  * Modeling Vector-Borne Disease 
  * Modeling Turtle Life History
* 3:00-3:30pm: Coffee Break
* 3:30-4:00pm: Research Snapshots __(instructors)__
* 4:00-5:15pm: Mentor research presentations (10 min each) __(Mentors)__
* 5:15-6:30pm: Work time + one-on-one student-instructor meetings
* 6:30-7:30pm: Dinner



**Sunday, Jan 12: “Putting It All In Perspective”**

* 6:30-8:00am: Breakfast
* 8:00-8:15am: Road Map and Daily Agenda 
* 8:15-9:30am: Lecture: Modeling in Practice: The Life Cycle of a Modeling Project, from Conception to Publication  
* 9:30-10:00am: Coffee Break
* 10:00-11:00am: Lecture: Looking back: How far have we come? 
* 11:00am-12:00pm:  Work time + one-on-one student-instructor meetings
* 12:00-1:00pm: Lunch
* 1:00-6:30pm: Women’s March Madagascar (optional), March will proceed from CVB to Ranomafana town. Speakers and activities for all who are interested. 
* 6:30-9:00pm: Farewell dinner in Ranomafana town (Hotel Manja)
* 9:30pm: Return bus to CVB

**Monday, Jan 13: (Travel Day)**

* 5:00-6:00am: Breakfast to go
* 6:00am: Board bus
* Return to Antananarivo 

**Tuesday, Jan 14**

* Mahaliana and/or IPM are open with WiFi connections for students to upload documents. We will have 1-2 instructors and 1-2 mentors on hand for office hourse to answer questions if students need help.

**Wednesday, Jan 15: "Sharing Your Work"** *(at [Institut Pasteur de Madagascar](http://www.pasteur.mg/) in Antananarivo)*

* 9:00-11:00am: Closing ceremony and final student presentations 
* 11:00am-12:00pm: Final Feedback Session
* 12:30-2:00pm: Farewell lunch
* 2:00-4:30pm: Mini-symposium: **“Modeling Insights Into Epidemiology and Ecology”** *(Instructor presentations)*
    * Instructor and mentor research presentations, (TBA, 5-10 min each + questions) 
* 4:30pm: Social Hour
